title: Opening Remarks
content: - 9 -   important policy message may be about how the central bank will respond to the   unexpected rather than what it will do if there are no surprises.  Unfortunately, at times   the dot plot has distracted attention from the more important topic of how the FOMC will   react to unexpected economic developments.  In times of high uncertainty, the median   dot might best be thought of as the least unlikely outcome.    Let me conclude by saying that I look forward to our discussions here and to the   ongoing work of the review that lies ahead.  We need the best tools and strategies   possible for dealing with the challenges we now face, and we must communicate them in   a clear and credible way.  My colleagues and I welcome your best thinking on these   issues.
